content.description: Streaking for Fame climbs the immaculate water streak on the right side of the Hall of Fame. If you like techy face climbing, this route is not to be missed! We originally thought the route was 11d, but that's a bit of a sandbag.
content.location: It is about halfway up the Hall of Fame on the right.

content.description: This looks a little broken and inconsistent, but enjoy the balancy sideways movements to small overhangs to thin crimps. There are probably not any full 11a moves, but three solid 10d sequences keep you honest.
content.location: One of the last routes on your left, before the overlook, Steroid is in the middle of three that share the same anchors.

content.description: This has lots of positive breaks on an easy slab.
content.location:
At the end of the corridor, there is a ledge on the right. This is smack in the middle, the second from the break. It shares anchors with

Another Route Here May Be

.

content.description: Salt of the Earth is a very unique looking climb, with crystal blocks down low, that narrow and give way to thin crystal pockets and edges.
content.location: Walk past 5 long harder sport routes on your left. When you come to a shorter crystal streak on your left, you've found this beautiful climb!

content.description: Really positive 5.8ish slab gives way to a short headwall/arete that will be kind of scary for new leaders at this grade.
content.location: At the end of the corridor, with the good view, there is a big ledge up on your right. This is the third route from the left, just left of a messy arete.

content.description:
There may be a little rope drag from going angled, but otherwise this is a great climb at this grade with slab, sidepulls, stemming, chickenheads, and all sorts of fun.

You can share anchors here with

Bobby Jones Dihedral

.
content.location: At the end of the corridor, there is a ledge on your right. This is the last climb on the right that starts on the ledge.

content.description: An easy slap leads to a small bulge and another 50' of easy slab.
content.location: At the end of the corridor, there is a large ledge on the right. This is just to the right of the most obvious break in the rock.

content.description: This is a one sequence wonder, easier with some length -- but a cool move surrounded by a lot of worthwhile 5.8 climbing. This route can share anchors with climbs on either side.
content.location: Before the end of the corridor, just as you come to the downed trees, there are three lines to your right. Bobby is the leftmost that starts on a smaller ledge up past the larger ledge.

content.description: Easy slab leads to an awkward little roof and a fun crack feature at the top.
content.location: At the end of the corridor, there is a ledge on the right. This is the second from the left that starts on the ledge.
